clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of Community Reablement on Instrumental Activities of Daily Living in People With Schizophrenia
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of Community Reablement on Instrumental Activities of Daily Living in People With Schizophrenia

lead_sponsor.agency: National Taipei University of Nursing and Health Sciences

clinical_study.source: National Taipei University of Nursing and Health Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized controlled behavioral intervention trial to assess the efficacy of investigating program of Reablement-Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (RE-IADL) on schizophrenia patients at immediately and long-term.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects will be randomized to intervention group and control group.The primary outcome included eight measures, Canadian Occupational Performance Measure, Instrumental Activities of Daily Living-3 Dimensions and Activities of Daily Living Rating Scale III, Mini Mental State Examination-2nd edition, Participation Measure-3 Domains, 4 Dimensions, Work Behavior Inventory, Schizophrenia-Quality of Life questionnaire and Beck Depression Inventory-II.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of the Canadian Occupational Performance Measure
primary_outcome.description: The Canadian Occupational Performance Measure assesses occupational performance. A higher score indicates better occupational performance. Changes of the Canadian Occupational Performance Measure well be assessed at the 0 week, 9 weeks, 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of Instrumental Activities of Daily Living-3 Dimensions
primary_outcome.description: Instrumental Activities of Daily Living-3 Dimensions assesses instrumental activities of daily living about 3 Dimensions. A higher score indicates better instrumental activities of daily living. Changes of Instrumental Activities of Daily Living-3 Dimensions well be assessed at the 0 week, 9 weeks, 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of Activities of Daily Living Rating Scale III
primary_outcome.description: Activities of Daily Living Rating Scale III assesses instrumental activities of daily living. A higher score indicates better activities of daily living. Changes of Activities of Daily Living Rating Scale III well be assessed at the 0 week, 9 weeks, 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of Mini Mental State Examination-2nd edition
primary_outcome.description: Mini Mental State Examination general cognitive function. A higher score indicates better general cognitive function. Changes of Mini Mental State Examination well be assessed at the 0 week, 9 weeks, 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of Participation Measure-3 Domains, 4 Dimensions
primary_outcome.description: Participation Measure-3 Domains, 4 Dimensions assesses social participation. A higher score indicates better social participation. Changes of Participation Measure-3 Domains, 4 Dimensions well be assessed at the 0 week, 9 weeks, 3 months.

Work Behavior Inventory assesses work behavior about chronic mental patients. A lower score indicates better work behavior. Changes of Work Behavior Inventory well be assessed at the 0 week, 9 weeks, 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of Schizophrenia-Quality of Life questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Schizophrenia-Quality of Life questionnaire assesses schizophrenia quality of life. A higher score indicates better quality of life. Changes of Schizophrenia-Quality of Life questionnaire well be assessed at the 0 week, 9 weeks, 3 months.
Beck Depression Inventory-II assesses the person about depression. A higher score indicates more depression. Changes of Beck Depression Inventory-II well be assessed at the 0 week, 9 weeks, 3 months.

intervention.description: RE-IADL program is to conduct trainings related to instrumental activities of daily living. For example,using communication appliance, moving in community, financial management, health care, housework, prepare meals and clear ,and shopping.
General community rehabilitation contains the activities in psychiatric rehabilitation center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of schizophrenia by DSM-5
- age > 20 years
- Stable mental symptoms
- Willing to sign the subject's consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of severe brain injury
- Substance abuse
- Diagnosis of intellectual developmental disorder
- Unable to follow instructions
